taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Greek rhabdos, rod, presumably alluding to ribbed capsule, and genus Weissia, alluding to resemblance]

bio:treatment.discussion: Rhabdoweisia is known predominately from the Northern Hemisphere. A strong case has been made to include this, as well as other genera, in the family Rhabdoweisiaceae Limpricht.

references.reference: Lawton, E. 1961. A revision of the genus Rhabdoweisia. Bryologist 64: 140–156.

key_statement.description: Leaves long-ligulate, 2–4 mm, broadly acute to obtuse, irregularly dentate in distal part, distal cells hexagonal, 14–20 µm wide, thin-walled relative to the lumina
Leaves linear-lanceolate, 2–3.5 mm, gradually and narrowly acute, serrulate in distal part, distal cells mainly quadrate, often wider than long, 10–14 µm wide, somewhat incrassate
